Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper-body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is relatively coarse, the interior is grooved, the exterior is covered with a brown slip, mottled with pink, and faint traces of one line of Coptic text written in black ink writ large.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394689) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394689)
